subject: the plot is stupid
body:
the new show _[how to with john wilson](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w7aSybHRa6s)_ on HBO, which is such a delightful surprise (my elevator pitch is _nathan for you_ crossed with _billy on the street,_ but fragmented and so visually dense and textured)

the new sofia coppola movie _on the rocks_ on apple tv+, which is probably not worth watching, even if like me your favorite movie when you were twenty was _marie antoinette_ and you have soft spots of varying size for her other work; bill murray is as bill murray as ever in it (which is a thing i like!) but the other characters are all so single ply toilet paper thin and the plot is stupid. 

that said, i'm still thankful i watched it because [the soundtrack](https://open.spotify.com/playlist/5Hd7CWFkZdQVs0oRv50xl1) hit me right in the musical sweet spot as her soundtracks always do, especially the clairo song "[sofia](https://open.spotify.com/track/7B3z0ySL9Rr0XvZEAjWZzM)" (a strokes song, softened) and michael nyman's "[in re don giovanni](https://open.spotify.com/track/7CdRIhBdjYGZRj0WChVYjN)" (minimalist sunshine)

other songs i love right now: "[golden](https://open.spotify.com/track/45S5WTQEGOB1VHr1Q4FuPl)" by harry styles and "[positions](https://open.spotify.com/track/7igeByaBM0MgGsgXtNxDJ7)" by ariana grande 

i haven't run outside in a week because of a cold snap but i think it's going to be sunny and still enough that i can go this afternoon after work

yesterday i rehydrated some dried morels that our parents gave us and made a sauce with them and some leftover portabella mushrooms and butter and the strained soaking liquid and that was quite good with pasta and roasted asparagus

prue on bakeoff about a questionable choice made by a baker: "i have hope, but not faith"

introducing d to vr and her giddy stumbles around our attic as she swung light sabers at blocks of light

when orson welles needed the sound of a vampire being staked for a radio version of dracula, he stabbed a watermelon
